answerText: variance[10] This doubly-eponymous bound provides a lower bound on the variance of estimators.  If an unbiased estimator's variance equals the value of this bound, then that estimator is unbiased. It can be calculated the inverse of R.A. Fisher's information.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 12 | 4 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: For a random variable x, this quantity can be calculated by taking the expected value of the square of the quantity x minus the expected value of x.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this measure of the spread of a data set that is also equal to the standard deviation squared.
